text:
One of those small hole-in-the-wall places. 
AMAZING PHILLY CHEESE STEAK.

I was starving and came here around 12PM. 
Place was pretty empty. Two other parties.
Lady who took our order was very nice. Said if we didn't try the Philly, we'd kick ourselves in the butt. I was going to order a Philly cheese steak anyway, so I did. 

Philly Cheese steak+mushroom+bell pepper+onions+BACONS
Everything about the meal was perfect. 
The bread was toasted and had this fluffy consistency to it.
It held everything together quite nicely. It was AMAZING.
Fries were crispy and nice. 
Only regret I have is not going back there the next day for more!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Paid about $10 which included tip. And I left feeling full as heck.

This review is for their food.

Great deals! Big basket of chips and salsa for one buck. Philly cheesesteak around $5 or $6 (don't remember) and it was all so good. 

My bf has brought home the Philly for me so often but I've only been in the bar twice. And from what I can tell, service is fair. 

Great spot for locals!

Went out to a party or club near UNLV and it's midnight? Hungry and want something reasonably affordable? If you answered yes to all of these questions then go here! I've been here only during midnight after a night out with friends. They have specials during this time for a lit price! I usually get the steak and eggs. It tastes great and for some reason their french fries are really good. It's a cool place to go with friends because there's two floors. The first floor is the bar and restaurant and the second floor is a pool area! Friendly service but food might take a while. Besides that you should definitely try it when you're out late at night. Also, the entire place smells like cigarettes immediately when you walk in, so if you don't like that then it's not the place for you.

Great food, great service and at an awesome price. Daily specials and happy hour; Bills games on Sunday and Buffalo fish fry on Friday. Pool tables upstairs and juke box downstairs. Any time day or night The Stake Out is always a solid choice.
Great food, great service, great prices!  Ribs were best I've ever had.  Jim the bartender is the nicest guy you'll ever meet.  Will be back again and again!  Enjoy!

My last and final visit here was horrendous.  I used to frequent this establishment for the low-cost good food, and friendly service.  The last experience was the worst experience I had ever had in a restaurant.  The bartender/manager ridiculed me for the server's poor performance, she had gotten my order wrong twice and it was not even a modified item.  I ate 1/4 of the plate before I had realized it was the wrong order.  The bartender/manager was incredibly rude to me, yelled, and told me I lacked common sense, that I just wanted a free meal ($7.99, really?), and was very condescending with her questions to me.  Apparently, because I ate 1/4 of the wrong food, I was to pay for it and be happy with their mistakes.  The bartender/manager was so angry she started tapping her hand on the table telling me "How it is".  There is more to this story but I just dont have the energy to talk about how terrible other people are.  I manage a very profitable restaurant, and know that even when a guest is WRONG (which I wasn't) you are to accomodate them, and be polite, as they are potential opportunities to make money or lose money.  If I was the owner, I would be outraged.  Good luck, you should take a hard look at who's really running your place and clean up the staff.

Husband and I went on a date here for lunch. We are originally from Buffalo and heard they had wings and fish fry, cheap! WE loved it...thought it was dark to start but that changed after a few minutes. We ordered a teriyaki burger, fish fry and chips and wings, 2 beers each and tip, all for 40 dollars...AWESOME. Then we headed upstairs to play a couple of games of pool. Really relaxed but clean atmosphere and the server, Liz was so wonderful and friendly and made it a point to learn our name and NOT forget us!! What a great date that we were way over due for!!!

Went to grab a bite on graveyard shift the Bartender takes our order. There was a black man very dirty clothes cleaning the mats then all of a sudden he goes to the back and starts to cook our food. The black cook was the same guy cooking our food he comes back out and continues to clean the mats again. By that time we were grossed out and left. I couldn't believe the same guy that was cleaning the dirty mats was cooking our food. GROSS. We would never return. Health code violation for sure!!!

I LOVE dive bars. Stake out is cool because they have good wings, fries, and .50 pool. Their happy hour is most of the day and makes domestic drafts $2. The staff is also very friendly. The only problem I have with the place is the massive amounts of cigarette smoke. The air is a little more clear on the second floor where the pool is!

If your looking for quiet hidden dive bar look no further then the stake out. Dark lighting, seldom busy, the majority of the few people who are in here are older locals who play video poker. Food is all good. Great chef. Taco Tuesday is the best deal two tacos for $1.75 and their amazing. Service is good may not be super fast with it never being very busy typically one bartender working, but they all very nice. Good place to check out!

Best Philly cheese steak in town, awesome chicken wings, great food all around. 
This place reminds me of cheers. 
Great gaming & great people.
A great place to be first went there five years ago when looking for a condo here and it is still my favorite place

Good food, affordable prices, nice atmosphere and friendly staff. The reason I give it 3 stars is because it was really uncomfortable due to the temperature; just too hot for Vegas weather. It was close to eating outside.
We asked the staff if they could turn up the A/C, but they replied that their manager wouldn't allow them to. If management was to change that ridiculous policy it would definitely be a great place to go.
Btw, the waitress was kind enough to give us cold  bottled water and discount voucher in a attempt to make us feel comfortable; that alone is 4 star service.

This place is great. I'm a UNLV student, recent grad actually, but sadly I didn't discover this place till the end of last year. I always saw the glowing pink neon in the corner of the strip mall but never thought anything of it. But to be honest it isn't much, nor does it need to be much. its charm is really how chill it is. The crowd is always relaxed and enjoying themselves, the place is never packed but never empty and the staff is always very friendly. The are open 24/7 as are most bars in Vegas, and they offer food that is surprisingly good considering the strip mall bar motif. again its not amazing but for what I would expect out of the location its great. and the happy hour specials are really good. Wings and Fries for 3 bucks? nice. This place is much better than the Freakin Frog in my opinion, and if you are a college kid and want a drink after class or a late night bite to eat, go to the Steak Out.

Awww good ole Stake Out!  What's not to like here.  The atmosphere is perfect, the food and portions are to die for, and the prices are even better.  Must tries are: buffalo wings, chicken finger sandwich, and the ribs that literally fall off the bone and have this unique flavor to them that i still cant pinpoint, but then again i dont think i want to.  A nearly perfect score for me the only thing that stops me from 5 stars is the pushy waitresses and bartenders.  Jim the bartender is great, but some of the female staff arent very welcoming.  Other than that if you're a local and you love Great not good Great food you must try Stake Out!  Youll thank me later.

Enjoy!!!

Classic bar food with a little twist here and there. Wings are worth it. Spaghetti has a great sauce, I'd be shocked if it actually was not home made. I always make it in too late for Sunday meatloaf!

Service has always earned 5 stars. We're especially fans of their server Jen Who runs around that floor, always with her smile.

I like the smoke, the booze and the broads. Every time I'm in the mood for a good knock down, drag out, good ole' fashion bar brawl, I head on down to Stake Out and BOOM! I get sucker punched walkin' through the door! Oh man! The fights will just make yo toes curl. One time my cousin Joey lost a tooth to some knuckle head Miami fan wielding a baseball bat. He's got one ugly grill these days and can whistle like angels sing! It's all in good fun, cause we SQUISHED THEM FISH! The Stake Out is the kind of place where you walk right in, Jimbo's got a leg up on the beer cooler, all smiles at ya and always yellin about how he needs to wake up. Jim's one sleepy SOB but he pours em strong and damn fine back up in a fight, if you get my drift. Not to mention, Jimbo can bring that' tail in and keep the party rollin'. Real good guy that Jimbo, real good guy.
Great Philly, great weekly specials. A step above normal bar food, for a step below in price. Friendly staff, and a mellow environment make it perfect for a quick after work bite.

Came here for happy hour last week just because I was in the area. Our waitress (unfortunately I don't remember her name) was REALLY friendly. We ordered:

half order of wings
shrimp and fries
chips and salsa
PBR

Everything tasted good, nothing special. Just typical bar food, but with the prices, its definitely worth coming back. 

We read they are known for their philly cheesesteaks which we weren't in the mood for, but next time, we're definitely trying it!

Marilyn Monroe and Frank Sinatra on the walls...cheesy music on the jukebox...$5 meatloaf specials on Mondays...free internet...I love Stake Out!  

You also can't beat steak and two sides for $9.99.  

The wait staff is usually very good.  I only had one bad experience because the waitress was new.

Drawbacks: the wine is terrible but they also serve beer.

love this place! great happy hour love the nachos

the best Philly cheese steak in town......actually the best I have had EVER!

PBR on tap is ice cold

I would never go there again. First of all, the neighborhood isn't great, the other customers weren't very friendly (to the point they were giving dirty looks!!), and the bartender was rude too. Since this place wasn't very welcoming, I decided to place a takeout order and they charged me 75 cents. Weird!
Best Philly in Vegas. Great food,even the rest of the menu is delicious, much better than expected "Bar Food". Service is great and the beer is low priced and cold!!
Good warm place, and family together is the best choice, please do not miss! Especially the beef dish?

This review is really just a warning to those looking for a place to eat without noxious cigarette smoke. Wasn't really busy; 10 people at the most. I couldn't stay in there for more than a minute before I changed my mind on eating here despite the good reviews. Dining area is adjoined to the bar so no avoiding the smoke.

My local hole for nearly seven years. Good food, good specials, good prices and friendly staff. You almost can't go wrong.

That said, I can't help but wonder why the owner hasn't upgraded the literally prehistoric credit card reader. (Whatever this is, it's not up to 90s standards.)  There's no way his staff hasn't complained, because it forces the servers to endure an awkward "please spell out your tip on this weird receipt / ticket before I swipe it" song  and dance. It was novel and quirky in 2004. It's idiotic in 2017.

Stake Out is a very clean dive bar right near UNLV. I came in on a Tues during happy hour. The tacos are crispy "Taco Bell" style tacos that are not extremely fresh but are certainly a great deal at $1.79 for 2 tacos. 
The food is cheap and good. They are terrible with drinking and gaming. We put $20 min in each of our machines (played the whole time) and NOT ONE OF OUR DRINKS WERE COMPED!  
They also charged me an extra $1.75 for each of my drinks because I ordered on the rocks, claiming they "poured more", which was not true and has NEVER happened to me in Vegas...especially in a dive.

EAT HERE!!

The prices have not changed... and the food has gotten better.
The service is PERFECT!! 

Oh, and the WiFi is still free!!

The beer list is pretty much domestics, regular beer, but i am sure that that helps them keep the prices low.

EAT HERE!!!
Been going there forever, the BEST Phillies in the world, seriously, and very friendly staff and owner. LOVE and miss this place as I don't work at UNLV anymore, but get food to go whenever I can.

My husband and I dined here on the 17th. We didn't know what we were really in the mood for and it was a late dinner (about 10PM). We figured we haven't been here for a while (about 4 months), so let's hit it up. 

I wish I would have said I wasn't in the mood. 

The service was great, so let's leave it at that and get it out of the way. 

I ordered the 1/2 rack ribs meal with a baked potato and salad. Chris ordered one of the hot sandwiches, which I can't recall right now. 

The taste was decent but it was better the last time I had it. The ribs were very tender and fell off the bones. 

The salad was a good portion, and with the low lighting, everything looked great. It wasn't until the end of the salad that I noticed all the BROWN WILTED SLIMY pieces of lettuce. Had the lighting been better, i would have likely seen that from the beginning. 

Chris had no complaints about his sandwich during the meal. 

We don't live THAT far from the bar - it took from finishing the meal, paying the tab, driving the 10 minutes home before I was hit with the aftermath of my meal. 

Good thing we have more than 1 bathroom, too- cause apparently we were both hating life for a short while. 

I was up and down all night with some additional puking the following morning. Chris said he felt "ok", but was sick all day the second day after (we can't be sure it was from that meal, but it could have been part of it). 

Needless to say, check your salads, and we WON'T be coming back.

My only lament is that this spot is not walking distance from my house. Stake Out is an awesome local somewhat divey in a good way, friendly neighborhood bar that reminds me of spots back in the Bay Area I used to frequent.  Drinks are decently priced, food is good, and the servers are friendly. What more can you ask for? 

It is near UNLV so you get a mixture of regulars and students mingling over drinks and video poker that only adds to the overall experience. I usually get the chicken tenders paired with a bourbon boilmaker to help relax in a super chill spot after a long week.

In town for business and looking for something off the strip. We all had the chicken fried steak, a few beers, then shared some cheesecake.
I definitely recommend this place.

We have been here three times to deliberately order different foods to see if everything we have experience is yummy ...and so far EVERYTHING we have had is sooooo good!
The ribs fall of the bone and perfect sweet / BBQ taste with the smoke to it. Oh yes!
The Caesar salad is huge and add chicken its a meal for a king/queen! 
Fried mushrooms oh man! Nice crisp bitter taste. 
The French dip...now I think their bread could have been better, but the meat was still yummy and dip oh so yes! The Cajun French fries has a season on them that sounds spicey, but it's not. It just gives them an Arby's taste. And the cole slaw! Watch out kfc! My new favorite because it has the sweet taste, but you can tell it's real home made style! 
The beers oh can we scream yes! 
The price is cheap! Specials all the time! And 24 hours. 
Defiantly come back again again and again!

This is a great bar. It's dive-y, but clean. It's in a strip mall near UNLV. But despite it's vicinity to UNLV, it's not overrun with students. On weeknights, it's fairly empty. They have numerous TVs and will put on whatever sports game you want. There's seating at the bar (if gaming). And there's booths and tables. They have happy hour deals (food and drinks) in the early evening and late at night. Their menu is plentiful and they have daily specials. I opted for the Philly cheesesteak. It wasn't as good as what I've had in Philly (duh), but it's better than most others I've had around town. The side of potato salad was pretty tasty too. The bartender was particularly attentive. But all in all, I'm a fan. It's a nice place to catch a game, drink, and eat.
Super cute place very calm to have a drink or a date. Try their steak and eggs everything is tasty and freshly made. Plus you can play and they have upstairs pool tables. Great place

I am a returning customer who eats here quite often..usually the food and the service is good...but today my experience was horrible...i ordered the bacon bleu cheeseburger with cajun fries..when the burger came there was no bacon in it and the fries were just normal fries so i politely told the waitress (first time i've seen her) who i ordered my food from and told her what was missing and what the problem was...when i asked if she can just go correct them she took my food and just gave me a glare...she came back a minute later with a knife and a side plate with two pieces of bacon on it and just said, "Here you can do it yourself" and walked away..not a very good way to treat your customers especially towards your loyal customers...I'm absolutely disgusted by the way i was treated today and will not be returning for a while...

Holy crap, this was the absolute best steak sandwich I have ever had.  The bun/roll was fresh, the steak was good quality and somehow they seemed to get a "log" of molten cheese in the middle of the steak.  YUMMY!!!  I will go back for sure!

Late night snack?  

My buddies and I were hanging out and was hungry.  One of them suggested Philly cheese.  2am? Philly? Make it happen!  We migrated here assuming they were still open and of course they were.  At first, I was very sketched how this place operates at night.  You got to ring a doorbell for entry.  For security since it is a bar.  Not your fancy dining or fast food type.  Bartender was very nice, doing his job he carded all of us.  Yay! we still look young! Woot Woot!  He asked if we like anything to drink, but we just wanted food.  He gave us a few waters to take with us to the table.  Seating area was small, simple.  Chairs and tables.  Obviously, we came for philly.  Easy? No, there were different options.  (Added bacon, extra cheese, etc).  Kept it simple went for the regular.  

Few moments later, time to eat.  Philly was served in a diner type way, basket with pickle, side fries.  Took one bite, not too bad.  Slices of meat was cooked well, but could use some more cheese.  I pictured cheese gushing out of my first bite.  My buddy, who is a philly fan, didn't think too much of it.  So I guess we are on the same page.  Worth a shot.  Couldn't expect too much since it's bar food.  At least it is open late night and beats getting a burger from some fast food joint.
Great food, great people, great fun. This place has a great atmosphere with very attentive staff and the food is cheap but doesn't skimp on quality. Try the Philadelphia Cheese steak, it is amazing.

Can't believe I haven't written a review yet.  Stake Out is the Friday after work staple - a perfect place to hang out with a revolving group of friends for a couple of pitchers and some grub.  My go-to dishes for food are the chicken caesar salad and now, thanks to a friend turning me onto it, the chicken philly with mushrooms. The vibe is totally unassuming and is more like a neighborhood bar than a bar in close proximity to a college.  The crowd is mixed, from UNLV staff to students to old bar flies, blue collar, white collar, hipster kids, you name it.  Surprise, surprise - they even have a track from my old band on the jukebox!
REAL BLUE CHEESE ON THE BLUE CHEESE BURGER! Great service, delicious philly cheese steak, and no wait -- even on NASCAR race weekend. overall excellent experience! :)
Had the philly tonight, it's pretty good. All the food is usually pretty good and the specials are good too. Stake Out is pretty reliable for late night meal people.

Food was delicious. We ordered the ribs and the BBQ Bacon Burger. Environment was pretty chill. Totally a locals hang out so I wouldn't want them to know I was a tourist :P But these little places always have the best food no matter where I travel. Why pay $40 for ribs on the strip when you can get them for $10-$15 and make it to match your appetites. Besides needing my food heated a little more to my liking everything was great. I would love to go back for breakfast.

Oh, the Stake Out.  Like Damon said in his review, it's a theatre kid hang out and it has been for as long as I can remember.  Ah, being a wee Freshman at UNLV and sneaking upstairs after a show is a fond, fond memory.

Even if you've missed the theatre bug (and lucky, lucky you) the Stake Out is just a good place to go when you don't feel like changing out of your jeans, and you just want to play a few racks of pool and have a pitcher of beer.  Their food is good as well, and their philly steaks are, dare I say it, awesome.  It's just a good, laid back little dive with cheap drinks and funny condom dispensers in the bathroom.  Just watch out for those theatre dorks.  They bite.

Food is good for a dive bar, but I'd be careful because sometimes it's disagreeable. The place is great. Servers and bartenders are among the best and friendliest I have encountered anywhere. I would go back time and again just to hang out there with fellow customers and the employees.

I've been a Stake Out regular for about 4 years now and the place rarely disappoints!  Day time cook, Mo, serves up some of the best bar food in town, delivered by the seasoned and charming Candy!  Morning, noon or night, the Stake Out has a relaxed and eclectic yet simple vibe.  The juke is easy to access, pool tables up stairs, booths or tables, a definite staple in my social, eating, and drinking reality!
I've been going for 25 years.  The Philly steak is incredible. Worth a $10 uber from the strip at ANY hour of the day or night to experience the best sandwich ever!

This place has not changed since in lived in Vegas almost 20 years ago.  I make a stop every time I go. 

I always have the the mushroom Swiss chicken sandwich  the fries and onion rings are great.

Can't go wrong with $1.99 domestic drafts from 1-7am. I usually come here once a week with my coworkers after a long shift. Great prices and food, the only downside to it being that you're sitting in a Buffalo Bills bar :P 

A trip to Stake Out requires one to order the chicken wings or the philly cheesesteak accompanied with a Miller Lite. 'Murca.

This place is the best! The servers are wonderful and the cook is amazing. All the food is great, and I can definitely be critical when it comes to my bar food. I used to live nearby and I wish I didn't live so far now only because of this place. Philly cheese steaks are the bomb, even the chicken one. Chicken wings are on point. Ordering them extra crispy is another good option. Fries are just like fries should be. Sandwiches deserve a shoutout. Everything is good. Good beer & drinks, good friendships, great place!! Cannot speak highly enough of a really awesome "dive"

Stake Out is the quintessential across from campus hangout.  The food is greasy, the beer is cheap and the atmosphere is casual.  Ive been known to knock back a couple after a hard test here or come by to watch a game.  The waitstaff is always pleasant and they have free wi-fi in case your putting the finishing touches on a term paper (because I always need beer to get me over the hump.)

The Stake Out gets a nice mix of people from students to faculty to after work professionals.  Everyone feels comfortable there.  Not the kind of place to come just for food but if you're having a beer or three its a nice compliment.  Overall a solid joint.  Never played the video poker inside but word on the street is its a little tight.  

PS- If you pay by Credit Card, they have this goofy system where you have to write your tip or tell it to your waitress so she can add it before she runs it.  I always am put off by this because I feel it influences me to leave a higher tip than I normally would.  Now I always pay by cash to avoid this. I suppose this is the Larry David neurosis in me :)

Living around the corner I decided to give it a try,, bad mistake,, cheesesteak bland no flavor,, ground beef-bun disgusting,poor kids almost ate crispy chicken fingers, crispy on the outside,hope they don't get sick,, thanks for nothing!!

What a dump! Terrible service, smelled like a foot, food literally made me sick. Worst bar in Vegas and I have lived here for 15 year. 

The owner literally doesn't want anyone who isn't gambling. They place cards all across the bar that says, " don't sit here."

Hands down thee best philly I have had out here, supper fast and hot. Great size as well, this will definitely fill you up I. Oils to even get to my fries, and to top it all of it is a great price I loved it guys keep it going defiantly will be here more often.

This is a Vegas staple for me. I love this place. Far enough of the strip that you loose the tourists, but still only a few minutes by cab or car. This somewhat dicey spot needs to buzz you in at the door. Once inside you find a handful of locals and unlv students.

The food is typical bar food. However the menu has a lot of options. The service is always polite and you can usually catch sports games or play some good music on the juke box.

This also becomes a last stop for many drunken locals after a hard night of partying. For those of you not from Vegas also remember that you CAN smoke inside.

The food is great and affordable. I have had the biscuits and gravy and the cheeseburger special both were perfect. The atmosphere is that of a dive but it's quaint. Will definitely be eating here everyday of my trip.
It is the defintion of time period of my life. I love this place so don't come here and ruin it with all your fucking stupidness. Come correct assholes.

The Stake-Out is probably one of the best bars in the UNLV area, and actually probably in Las Vegas as a whole. 

The atmosphere of the place feels more like an older neighborhood bar as opposed to the bars one would usually find around the university area. It's really dark inside, and the walls are decorated with a mixture of sports paraphenila and old movie posters...classic rock is almost always blaring from the jukebox, unless a football game is on.

The staff is pretty helpful...and consists of a staff of blonde waitresses who were probably working there when the place opened however many years ago.

As for the food, it's not too bad. I personally only ever order the daily specials, which are usually pretty decent. Sunday is the best day to go, as they have the $5.49 All You Can Eat Spaghetti and Meatballs w/ Garlic Toast. Totally delicious!

The Cajun Chicken sandwich is also pretty good, as is the hamburger. I'd steer clear of the Chips and Salsa though, unless it's happy hour, because they really just taste like Tostitos Chips and Salsa.

Upstairs, there's a couple of mini pool tables that are only .50 a game that seem to be unpopulated most of the time. It can be a nice quiet hang-out if you're looking to get away from people on the second floor.

I also can't go without mentioning how awesome it is that there are machines in the bathroom that sell condoms and small pamphlets with different sexual position guides. Unfortunately, this isn't something seen too much anymore, and for some reason it's always a nice touch.

Overall, an awesome place. :D
Went there for lunch. Great cheesesteak at a good price. The service went above and beyond to make sure we had a great experience. The only downside was the amount of bar smoke.

This place is an often overlooked Vegas treasure. Laid back college bar that manages to not have the "frat" vibe. On the contrary, it feels more like a neighborhood bar you'd find in an older community. The clientele is a mix of older people from the neighborhood and college students. 

Great food first and foremost, especially the ribs, cheese steaks and wings. Good happy hour specials, and on top of all that, free wifi that is the fastest I have found around town. One of the places you can find me on a regular basis when I am home.

Hello. My name is Joe. In general I try never to speak with people, but I have been drinking at this bar and it's damn good. You should try it.

You should know that my recommendation is essentially a guarantee. Drink here now.

I went here we'd 2/2 around 1:30 pm.  The Server was the bartender.  We ordered some sodas and waters.  There were no other people in the place eating but she had 6 patrons at the bar gaming and drinking.   Several new gamblers came in and they received their drinks before the lady even came back.  It's been 7 minutes now and we still haven't gotten our sodas but she was busy lounging at the bar doing something with her phone.  Obviously she totally forgot about us but still had plenty of time to play on her phone.  I had to go up to the bar to remind her we were still waiting on our beverages.  I was amazed at her poor service.  Remember there was no one else eating.  Finally we got our beverages 10 minutes after we sat down.  We ordered two cheesesteaks with bacon.  We received our subs 12 minutes later and she forgot the bacon on both of our subs.  I was famished so I just ate it.  The food was extremely subpar and probably one of the worst cheesesteaks I have had in this town.  They only have white American cheese for their cheesesteaks which didn't help at all.  She basically ignored us the whole time and never came back to see how the meals were.  Of course we had to go to the bar to ask for a box and our bill.  She was polite but her service was lacking.  This was obviously a place where they only care about gamblers and ignore the diners.  I would not recommend this place if you are looking for a good meal.

This is the after hours spot. It's cheap and has good bar food. Service is ONLY good late night with the male bartender. Majority of the servers say inappropriate stuff, and some  look like they used to be junkies.

I am marking this down to three stars because I have come to realize that I am giving away four stars like they are candy. I've eaten here several times and truth be told it's a bar with bar food. It's good for a neighborhood bar, but it there is not reason to rate it above any of the other hundreds of thousands of neighborhood bars across the nation. If you live test to it then make it's our local watering hole, it's worth it. However, it's not worth more than a 10 minute drive.

Went there on a Sunday night around 7.  Walked in, no one greeted us (as to be expected, its a bar for goodness sakes) so we sat ourselves.  5 min later a couple sits down in the booth next to us.  The waitress comes over once to greet them, they aren't ready to order so she brings them water.  Still not ready to order, she begins to share her life story.  She just started so be patient with her, she used to work....her kids....her house....etc.  My friend and I patiently wait while thinking when she is finished her life vomit she will come take our order.  No chance.  She goes to put in their order and proceeds to talk to bartender.  We decide to go somewhere that wants our business and as we get up to leave still no one says a word to us.

I won't speculate as to why we got such horrible service.  It looks like a decent neighborhood bar with cheap drinks and greasy food, exactly the kind of place we are trying to find except it would be nice to actually get drinks and food.

Next time I will try sitting at the bar...much harder to ignore me there.

Strike ONE!
This place is a lot of fun; especially for bar hoppers. The food is really good. The staff is soo friendly omg. I would definitely come back here again.

When i ordered i didn't even realize this was a full on bar. Very cool setting, with upstairs and pool tables. The staff was friendly and the place gave me the sense of nostalgia. I'd recommend as a good spot if you want a drink or want good bar and grill food. The philly cheese steak was excellent and I would go again. The price was not that expensive but they didn't take Amex which was a stickler.

I love this place. I graduated from UNLV a few years ago, and because the Stake Out is so close to the school and the places I used to hang out at as a college kid, it's like a nostalgic treat every time I come here.

I'm no food junkie, so I cannot comment too much on quality. To me, bar food is bar food. I do know, however, that most of the food here tastes does good, and it's been only a few times I've gotten some appetizers that, well... didn't look very appetizing. The drinks (which is the main reason I go here) are excellent, mixed drinks never watered down (unlike many station casino bars), and are served quick. The waitresses are always nice, and the service is top notch. Add points if you're a regular customer, they always remember you. Also, the juke box is a very nice touch.

I like this place too, because it is almost never really too crowded. Certain days it does get busy, particularly when there is some kind of event going on near the school (i.e. Rebels basketball game), or has college kids celebrating after a finished day of finals. However, this is a small price to pay for the great service. It is currently the main place where me and my friends go to unwind after a long day at work, and will probably remain so as long as I stay in Las Vegas.

Stake Out is a neighborhood favorite!! It's definitely a divey sports bar, but it's cozy and you won't always leave reeking of stale cigarette smoke -- which is a plus in my book!

Not only is the bar aspect always pleasant and poppin' with friendly regulars, but the food served here is enough of a reason to stop in. Far better than your average bar food in my opinion, with a wide variety of things to choose from - salads, sandwiches, chicken, nachos, etc. And to make it even sweeter, they run some pretty awesome Happy Hour deals on drinks & appetizers every day of the week.

I suggest swinging by and ordering one of their famous Phillies & a pint from the graveyard bartender Jim - He's the BEST!!! :)

Not a bad place to go during happy hour.  The philly cheesesteaks are really good.  A pretty good place to drink especially for UNLV students since it's just across the street.  Not as much room as most bars I go to, but the place doesn't ever get overly packed with people.  There are televisions filled with games, service is friendly, and the atmosphere is good enough where I can enjoy talking to my friends without it being too loud.
From out of town and read the good reviews. It was even better than we expected large portions very tasty very friendly waitress! If I lived in town I would come here every week.
Visiting from Texas. This place has a dive bar feel, with really good food. I've eaten here twice already.

laughably, the woman made us leave the gaming machine seats, even though her friends were at machines but not playing. There were 9 more open machine seats. I did notice the pay tables were robbery. Do Not Gamble here. the mixed drinks are over priced and no HH specials for them. The Philly steak was above average, Fries above average, service poor. I like going to a dump if they treat me well, I don't piss and moan about smoke, but I expect to be treated reasonably well. Sadly, this is a bar living off unknowing gamblers that don't know paylines

Ahhh the Stake Out. One of UNLV's dive bars. Like all the other dive bars, this has personality. However, it also has really good food.

Stake Out is a Buffalo Bills bar, so naturally, a wave of depression and crushed dreams hit you as you walk in the door. Don't let that deter you. There is good to be had. They had specials every day of the week. The best being Taco Tuesday, where two tacos are dirt cheap and they are loaded with ground beef. Tacos not your thing? Arguably the best thing on the menu is the crispy chicken sandwich. It used to be only available on Wednesday, but due to popular demand, it's an everyday thing. 

Oh and yes, their Philly Cheese stake sandwich. Does it make you think you are in Philly? No, but it's pretty darn good. There are a ton of great food options here. Even if it isn't on the level of crispy chicken sandwich, you can sleep easy as you will get well sized portions.

What about drinks? Stick to beer. Seriously. I've never had a mixed drink at the Stake Out that was any good. I'm not talking about a bad Manhattan or a non spicy Bloody Mary. I'm talking about a messed up Jack and Coke. Seriously. Have I made that clear? Don't get mixed drinks. Plus, draft beers usually have some decent options. I like to get Sam Adams Rebel IPA on draft. 

Remember that personality thing I mentioned earlier? Stake Out has super sweet servers but don't be surprised if they need gentle reminders or if cashing out your check is a bit more work than you planned. If you are in a rush, I would probably ask for your check 15 minutes before you think you need to ask for it. This has been truth for lunch time and I've been at night when it's a bit better but same concept applies. 

Oh and it's smokey. But you probably figured that out by now. Dive bars wouldn't be divey without the air quality being at least 75% Marlboro. 

Why 4 stars with all these seemingly negatives? You didn't ask that question but I'll answer it. It's a dive bar, through and through, but the positive is great food and nice service. Yes, it's smokey and can be loud and service can be slow but I love it, warts and all. Give it a shot, you will too.

Wow, angry, I could spit nails. 
On the recommendation of Yelp reviews, I sought this establishment out. I ordered (take out) wings, telling the waitress to tell the cook to please cook the wings crispy. (Which she did tell the cook.) After getting back to my hotel, only did I discover rubbery wings, the meat inside was raw. Also the Buffalo sauce did not even stick to the wings because they were so raw. I should have checked my order before leaving. My fault.
Waitress was friendly and efficient. Just the cook obviously cannot cook the simplest of foods.

I've been going to Stake Out for years and I used to really like this place. It was super cheap, the staff was always friendly and the food was always awesome consistently. 

However, I went there about a week and a half ago and sat at the bar with a co-worker around happy hour on a week day and was informed that we'd have to sit upstairs (since seats with machines were only for players). They gave us an option to sit at the crotch of the bar, wedged between two machines, which was really a slap in the face. I've been coming to this place for almost ten years and always sat at the bar in front of machines and not gambled. In fact, most the of the people sitting at the machines looked like shiftless hobos and degenerates. I'd say it was only at about 30% occupation. I'm not sure if this place is falling on hard times or what.

Anyway, we declined and walked next door to the Freakin' Frog. We actually made it for their happy hour and got 2 for 1 beers. I didn't eat though since the food looked questionable at that place, but still a much better experience. 

I can't say I'll never go back to Stake Out (because I probably will), but still that was really weak. The only reason I'm giving Stake Out a 2 star review is because it used to be cool.

It's rather dingy, dark and smoky inside...but the Philly cheesesteak is the best we have ever had. Beats our Colorado favorite 'Taste of Philly' by a mile. I would suggest taking it to go unless you like the bar scene. However, service was awesome.

Taco Tuesday is where it is at!

I come here for lunch occasionally since I work at UNLV. I know plenty of my co-workers enjoy this little dive gem for lunch as well. 

So it is kind of dimly lit and you can buy weird condoms in the bathroom and it smells like smoke but you cannot beat their lunch deals. Every day is different but Tuesdays have 2 tacos for $1.50 or something like that. A good value for some crunchy tacos. 

I have also tried their philly cheese steak which comes in a basket the size of french bread. I enjoy their philly although the meat is more like ground beef than thinly sliced steak. The onions came on top of it when I really prefer to have the onions really cooked in with the meat. But truly, it is a decent sandwich and a good price too. 

I am totally partial to dive bars. The staff are really the sweetest people and make you feel welcome.

Before becoming vegetarian, I used to hit up this place monthly (or weekly in the summer) for Taco Tuesday. I still dream of Taco Tuesday, and the delicious and filling tacos that are 2 for $1.50. 
I would imagine this place would be good for game watching, and it is a Buffalo sports bar, so if you are a Bills or Sabres fan, this maybe your place. 
The service was always friendly and good for being packed on Tuesdays. The clientele I always saw was college students and UNLV faculty and staff, but I am sure it varies noting the location.

Not bad at all.
 I've been here a few times. First time, it was before a late class and a friend and I were craving some wings. We ordered a side of veggies and dip and it all came out to like 12 bucks.  Awesome. 
I've also ordered the steak and eggs (4.95) which comes with plenty of sourdough  toast and seasoned potatoes.  Always super pleased.
The place is like a bar with some restaurant seating on the side. Never rowdy and always great service despite it being 24 hrs.

I came late to my meetup group and this new server with a horrible attitude, never served or asked me, the 40mins I sat down with my service dog. Never felt so badly discriminated before and passed over as if I'm not worth this business time and money.

I can't for the life of me figure out why this place has 4 stars. Initially I saw some outlying reviews about the texture of a phillycheese steak and crunchy chicken fingers, but that seemed to be the end of the negative reviews with the exception of the ambience of this dingy hole of an establishment. 

However, throughout my experience here on a Wednesday afternoon I can't seem to figure how it took them 30 minutes with only 3 other patrons in the bar to take our food and drink order, we had to flag her down in which the server replied, "oh, I thought I already took your order." We did receive our drinks quickly, but noticed that our food sat in the window for 7 minutes before we had to flag her down again and ask if our food was ready. In which we had been here for an hour and 15 minutes before we actually got food down in front of us. 

The food and service isn't decent enough for me to return here. Their bland and soggy fries don't entirely entice most patrons unless you're down for that kind of thing. We spend most of our meal debating whether or not our chicken was undercooked because of the pink lights. 

My friend Kim would like to add that "the wing sauce was not bad... I've tasted worse."

We are honestly extremely confused at how this establishment has 4 stars as it appears like this is a normal for this place. Unless you are sitting at a bar stool, all dining customers are ignored.

On a plus side, I like the music. 

Happy Eating.

Dimly lit and with the feel of an old town dive bar, Stake Out is definitely a hidden gem. I've been several times and never had a complaint about anything I've ever eaten here. Waitresses are attentive but not overbearing, and choosing where you want to sit is a big plus for me! Try the ribs, they literally are the best in Vegas!
Great food! But I've never been able to try the Rubin; they are always out! Please make more Rubins
Dirty. The food isn't good and the bartenders are rude. Sorry for wasting your time by trying to give you business. The bar was empty and was still treated like they couldn't be bothered.

Stake Out is one of those neighborhood favorite divey taverns in the University area of LV. The mood in here is extra dark, which can be a good thing if you're into that sort of stuff. The people in here are very nice as its mostly locals and regulars. Its a good place to catch a game because it is never too crowded in there, and the bartenders are nice where they'll change the sound to the gamecast if no body objects in the bar. The service of this place is brisk and quick, with very friendly servers.

As for the food, I'd hate to say this but it is only decent. Its one of those places where you definitely need to know what to order to have a good dining experience. However, one thing that they guarantee is that their PRICING IS ABSOLUTELY VALUE. Its one of those places where you can catch early dinner (before 7pm) for under 10 bucks (alcohol/tax/tip excluded). I give it a 5 stars because its pretty much thee watering hole of UNLV, which will always be special to me.

Some food items I would recommend: Cheesesteak, Burgers, Ribs, Happy Hour Chips and Salsa (only 99 cents to munch on with your beer), Happy Hour Wings ($3.50/4), Fries. 

Things that need work: Nachos, its not a very good one. Some daily specials (Chef salad, all you can eat spaghetti Sundays)

BTW THEY DO NOT TAKE DISCOVER AS A FORM OF CREDIT CARD.

Yeah, I can confirm what these two said.  My two best friends were theatre guys at UNLV and this was our drinking base of operations.  One night we stole ketchup bottles and began throwing them around outside.  We had reached epic levels of drunk that night, do in part to the charm of the Stake Out.  

When I wrote my book "Why Won't She Call Me Back?" (available at fine online retailers) I based the main bar on the Stake Out.  Good times.

Sure, it's a neighborhood pub, and smokey. But it has all the things you look for in a local joint. Good staff who remember you. Excellent grub. Decent prices. The game is always on. Oh, and ginger beer!! 

They also have an incredible meeting room upstairs. Private, roomy, perfect for events. I went to a Toastmasters meeting there and it was awesome.
Great food especially for Philly cheese steak sandwich also their buffalo chicken wings and friendly bartenders

Wow. Well if you are a degenerate from the area, you have been here. They have amazing food. They have great prices. They have great people. Usually you'll find yourself paying for your professor's drinks at this place - especially if you are a finance major. 
They do not have Corona, they do have Peroni and when the bartender tells you that they are similar, they are not. 
This place usually has some sort of sunday dinner thing going on, and that food is fantastic.

I was a little skeptical of this place, as it's tough to live up to the reputation of being  the "best of" something.  It may not have been the best cheesesteak I've ever eaten, or even had in Vegas for that matter, but it was a very solid lunch.  I went on a Friday afternoon during summer, so it was nearly empty.  A couple of dudes playing video poker, and every table was empty.  So, service was quick and attentive.  The server was very friendly and had suggestions, which is always appreciated at a place you've never been.

To eat, I had the cheesesteak with peppers, onions and banana peppers, which cost a quarter.  I went with the Cajun fries.  The server offered to bring some ranch, and I asked if it was homemade.  She said it was and it was great, and she was right.  It was a very good ranch, much better than any bottle.  She also offered the honey mustard as the "best in the city."  I had to give it a shot, and again, it may not be the best I've ever had, but it was a pretty damn good honey mustard.  

The sandwich was solid, but inconsistent.  The bread mostly held it together, but in places where it was wetter, it would lose integrity.  And, the cheese wasn't consistently placed on the sandwich.  Some bites had a lot of cheese (needless to say, these bites were the best) and some were dry.  When you get all ingredients, the sandwich is very good.  But, there were dry areas as well.  The fries were good, and you get a heap of them along with 2 pickle spears.  Very fair price for the amount of food you get.  The specials looked good, and all of them were cheap.  I'll be back to give them a shot

Great place to watch the Buffalo Bills play.  Their Friday fish fry special is excellent.  The fish fry is the same style that you would get at a Buffalo bar.  If you're from WNY, that should be a place for you.  Only wish they served beef-n-weck every day besides fame day.

The service is very hit or miss here. Thought it might be when the large crowds are here to pregame before the UNLV games at the Thomas and Mack center which I totally understand.    Service has been a little slow when it wasn't busy as well mainly in regards to the bartender getting drinks to the waitress in a timely matter or cashing out the check.

 I enjoy the Chicken Philly loaded with everything and Cajun fries. A perfectly chilled Fat Tire makes my meal complete.

The happy hour specials are spot on. 
Appetizers I highly recommend include deep fried mushrooms as well as mozzarella sticks.

They also run daily dinner specials which I enjoy Wednesday which is typically the evening I go to meet with the League of Extraordinary Comic Fans is Spaghetti and Meatball night. 

The food is fantastic here and the beers are always cold. 

Happy dining.
I love their Mac n cheese balls. We come on Taco Tuesdays often for some cheap food and a drink. I like the chill atmosphere and the bartenders and servers are pretty nice.
Great dive bar. It's a Buffalo Bills bar but as an Oilers fan I still had a great time. The GM Jim was the bartender and he was great. We had a $2 beer.

Ahhh Stake Out... my go-to spot when I'm in the area for reliable food at fair prices and reasonable drinks.

To be honest... this may deserve 5 stars. They don't try to dress this place up as something that its not. Its a dive-"y" type bar that caters to locals and college kids. Pool tables upstairs and some of the best bar food at the cheapest prices you will find. I have not had one dish I have not enjoyed yet. The meatloaf sandwich special on mondays is my favorite dish. So freaking good.

The all-you-can eat pasta is ehh... but who orders pasta at a bar?!

Anyway--- this is a hidden gem and not many non-UNLV students know about it. It's in the plaza next to Freak'n Frog.

Go try it! You will be shocked at the food quality for the price.

Their cheese steak from Philly excites my willy. Now, I'm not from Philadelphia, not a cheese steak expert either. HOWEVER, I have ordered this classic sandwich from time to time, and have NEVER been impressed. I would keep thinking to myself, they can't ALL suck this bad, this is a classic sandwich, there HAS to be a reason they are popular. Today I sank my teeth into the most delicious Philly cheese steak sandwich I have ever had. Wifey had a chicken mushroom sandwich, which fell into the delish category too. Everything we had was surprisingly good, for the rock bottom prices they charge. Fries, good, slaw, good, though too creamy/not enough cabbage for my taste. Waitress was friendly, service spot on.  

We popped in on a lazy Sunday, sports on the tube(s), classic rock on this crazy old device called the radio.. The crowd was light and pretty diverse. This place is reminiscent of an old pair of favorite shoes. Well worn, comfortable, maybe a little tattered on the edges, yet still has plenty of soul.

For cheapo eats, Steak Out is hard to beat.

Best Philly in Las Vegas. 
Happy hour is 3-7.

If you get here early amazing deals on food! Other than that it's a decent place to eat and kick it. Tried to go here one night the day of a game at the Thomas and Mack and it was packed. So probably a good sports place. 

I like the waitresses though. Pretty and nice and sweet :)

Best food in Paradise!! Great food and friendly staff.  I like to study in the booths and play pool upstairs. Been stopping in for years, will continue to do so for many more! 

A+++ would recommend to anyone looking for a dark dive that's clean and welcoming. Once again, food is outstanding!

After guzzling ourselves to death, my friend and I ended up right over here from the Freakin' Frog to end up with a cheap but HUGE Philly and fries while the bartender talked to us about all kinds of sports, his life, the place, and everything else.  It was winter break week, so we were the only ones in the joint -- it was an odd affair, but considering we were kind of blasted, comforting to not have to worry about anyone else seeing us in such a condition.

The place was delicious and amusingly dive-y.  Maybe we can try it sober and not at 3:00 AM next time!

This a great late night and play pool hang out.   Post or pre-party it's pretty cool too.  It's just one of those places to congregate with no fuss.

I love places where you can still order a pitcher of beer.  Stake Out has always been an after event tradition with the theater crowd here in Vegas. (yes, there's theater in Vegas....I'm not claiming it's the best, but, we're growing.)  And it's right across from the new University Theater. The Stake Out might pick up a bit since it's now across the street from an all-ages venue with no liquor.

So.....beer it up and play some pool, all night long if you like. They even have a conference room if you need to rent it for the night....how Elk Lodge is that?

This place rocks.  Technically a dive bar, but with great food.  I've never tried anything but the cheesesteaks, so can't speak for anything else.  Waitresses are awesome, and even offered me a piece of chocolate covered bacon someone made.  Probably not safe, but super friendly.  The sex guides sold in the bathroom for 50 cents are a bonus, too.

I was on a business trip in Vegas and decided to look for something not necessarily on the strip. I ran into this page and everything looked great. When we got there it was just the right atmosphere to end the day, good music was playing, good mood all around, and great food! The people there are really friendly! If in ever in Vegas again I will make sure to go back. Definitely give this place a try if you're looking for good food!
If you like dive bars and bomb bar food. This is the place to go. Friendly staff good food affordable drinks. What else could you want.

I am not having the best luck when it comes to restaurants that boast the best of anything. I know that the Stake Out is the quintessential college dive bar hang out for their cheap menu and happy hour specials, but I was not impressed with their Philly at all. It just tasted like pepper. Don't get me wrong, I am a huge fan of black pepper, but this was even too much for me. It did not taste like very much of anything else. What I did like were the wings. I should have ordered a double portion of these because they are fantastic. Crisp, golden chicken tossed in mild sauce with some hot sauce on the side. I have to saw that their version of hot is not very spicy. It is flavorful. Combine that with how well they cook their wings, I am okay with it. I would say pass on the cheese steak and come for happy hour when their wings are half off.

While the location is sketchy, the cheesesteak sandwich is great.  I prefer extra cheese and all the veggies. I've been for lunch and dinner and never to so smokey that I did not want to eat there.  This is a simple neighborhood bar that serves a great cheesesteak!
A bit slow, and if I am honest, not worth the wait. I had the famous Philly cheesesteak sandwich , mine must have come from Denver.

Stake Out is, by far, my favorite bar in town! First off, know this is a neighborhood bar, so don't expect a DJ or a dance floor. I have been going there for years because of three things: atmosphere, quality, and price. 

The atmosphere at Stake Out is fantastic. Everyone I have met there is willing to socialize with their groups, as well as the strangers around them. The bartender, Gia, will make anything you want and is always up for a challenge. There is a waitress there, Summer, who is not only hilarious, but has a very warm personality. She tries to get to know her clients and make everyone feel right at home. Jim, the owner, takes pride in Stake Out. He comes in every night and can always been seen helping out behind the bar or serving the patrons. Quality guy for sure. The old time pictures and Christmas lights also add charm and uniqueness to the venue that gives it a very homey feeling. 

My friends and I have never eaten a bad meal. Everything we order comes out quickly and tasting great. I would definitely suggest getting a cheese stake, it's definitely what they are known for.

Finally, Stake Out offers some of the best prices in town! It's not many places that you can get a cheese stake with fries for around $8, and a pitcher of beer for around $10. 

Overall, I've probably been to about 20 bars in this city, but none of them come close to Stake Out! I highly recommend giving it a shot!

Endless spaghetti Sunday. Bomb bar food! Cheap drinks. Always dim. Video poker if your date is boring. Or if you are boring. Spacious booths. Pool table upstairs. Framed photos of like, Marilyn Monroe and shit... Many friends of mine have spent full days in here. I'm probably guilty of the same crime but uh, I WAS day drinking around the corner from my apartment ok? Don't you judge me on Yelp.

When a bar isn't this bar, I'm always kind of sad inside secretly. I seriously consider moving back to Las Vegas just for The Stakeout. I would trade every last stone cold hot tall hipster idiot dude in brooklyn (who ALL dress better than me btw) for a Stakeout here in NY. Because although these fine lads make my commute much more visually stimulating, they can't hold a damn flame to one of Nevada's hidden gems.

Good, affordable food. Nice place to enjoy some food and play pool with friends. 

Another restaurant that I would enjoy more if it wasn't filled with smoke.

My friends frequent this place and it took a drunk bus full of co-workers to finally get me here. Damn it! I have been missing out! 
Great food, great bartenders & great atmosphere. Simply put, it's just a great local dive bar. 


Been meaning to come back for more!
Great spot to have a drink and play pool! It's a cute lil dive bar. The atmosphere feels really relaxed, chill and friendly. Their Philly cheesesteaks are the best I've ever had yet!

Yelp has ask when doing this review is there a POKEstop nearby?  WTF! That's fu*@king stupid.  The food is great, the bartenders awesome.  Great dive bar.  Yelps probably going to delete this review like that last one.

I started my night of bar hopping with a friend here at Stake Out. 

Our bartenders were extremely nice! Two older ladies who made a point to ask for our names, chat with us, and tell us about themselves. Our service was a bit slow, even though the place was nearly empty.

There are two pool tables upstairs that are only 50 cents a game! This is definitely one of my go-to spots to play pool.

The beer and alcohol list is a little sparse, but the price is right. If you want some nice beers, walk over to the Freakin' Frog, but enjoy the domestic beers and cheap food while you are here.

We ordered a few tacos (Taco Tuesday - two for $1.49) which were satisfying, but average tasting. 

This place has the most awkward men's bathroom I've ever been in.

All in all, I'll definitely come back to play pool upstairs and chat with the bartenders, but probably wouldn't make it a point to come here if I didn't want to play pool.

If you ever have those late night cravings for a drink and satisfying bar meals, I would have to say Stakeout is one of the better local bars that's 5 minutes from The Strip. The bar is two stories: the first where the bar is obviously located, and tables and booths to sit down to have a meal if you don't want to eat at the bar itself. Upstairs is the pool hall and social area for drinking, eating, and other miscellaneous things. Stakeout is unique in the sense that it's two stories and you don't feel like you're in an overly crowded atmosphere, even when it is busy.

Their food is on the heavy side with ingredients, so it'll leave you feeling pretty satisfied walking out the door. The Philly Melt is one of the more popular ones, and after trying it, it has to be one of the best sandwiches I've had on their menu. I'm not too crazy about the French Dip, for the au jus that comes with it is flavorless at best, and the meat along with the bread is pretty bland. Otherwise from that, you also can't complain about the buck dollar chips and salsa. 

Overall this is one of the more better local bars I've been to in Vegas. A much younger crowd (including college people) can be seen here.

I love the Stake Out. I go there to study, eat, hang out, and drink cheap beer. Jim and Summer are great bar tenders. The veggie burger is good, and they can make you a vegetarian Philly cheese stake sandwich if you ask. 

On the down side, quite a few students come to study, it's a little too dark in the booths, and sometimes they won't turn up the lights.

I only ever eat here for Taco Tuesday's! But their tacos and taco salads are really good and it is a great price too!

Since my work offices are right around the corner, it is a great cheap lunch to look forward too!

I believe it is 2 tacos for 99 cents and taco salad is only $2.99 (but don't quote me, you can definitely get out of there with a meal under $5). . .

I prefer the taco salad!

Wonderful Sandwiches here, I love the Reuben, the service is a little slow if you are not sitting at the bar, but then again the price is so low it covers for it. Jim is an awesome bartender that works graveyards there, though we only met him once.
